[http://moto.arrisi.com/Video-Solutions/US-EN/Products-and-Services/Voice-and-Data-Consumer-Premise-Equipment/DSL-Modems-IADS-and-Gateways/ADSL2-Gateways-and-Voice-IADs/ci.2247-N8-Netopia-ADSL-802-11n-Wi-Fi-Gateway-US-EN.resources Product page]
[http://www.motorola.com/web/Home/Products/Voice-and-Data-CPE/xDSL-Modems-IADS-and-Gateways/2247-N8_Netopia/_Documents/StaticFiles/Netopia_2247-N8=_User_Manual.PDF?pLibItem=1&localeId=33 User manual] It can probably be safely assumed this device uses a BCM636x CPU. :The Chinese internets are [http://auction1.paipai.com/search/0/947588A7000000000401000019157DEB-8821.html pointing towards BCM6361].. and also specify the Flash and RAM as 16 and 64 MB, respectively. "25"?"-542600-403" is silkscreened on the top of the board in the FCC photos. "(C) Motorola Inc. 2010" appears to be silkscreened on the bottom. :"250-542600-403 B" is silkscreened on the board in the images below.. :'''Aztech''' would seem to be the manufacturer of this revision. "U61L220T00", "REV.0 GP", and "308.01191.015" is silkscreened on another (production) board. '''Foxconn''' would obviously seem to be the manufacturer. :The S/N of this unit is 164325850624. The MAC is 00:26:42:95:7E:00. It is manufactured in China. :The device is using a '''Spansion''' FL128PIF (16 MB) Flash and a '''Winbond''' W9751G6JB-25 (64 MB) RAM chip. The board has a single U.FL connector for the second integral antenna. The power adapter included with the device is a '''Leader Electronics Inc.''' MU18-2120150-A1 (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A). It is '''Motorola''' P/N 574958-001-00. {{WiFiCert|WFA10946|06/20/2011}} ==Images== Image:Netopia 2247-N8 1.jpg|top Image:Netopia 2247-N8 3.jpg|back Image:Netopia 2247-N8 4.jpg|label Image:Netopia 2247-N8 6.jpg|board top Image:Netopia 2247-N8 2.jpg|CPU and RAM Image:Netopia 2247-N8 5.jpg|non-board antenna [[Has images::external| ]][[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::label| ]]
